content.description: In eastern gray squirrels, Sciurus carolinensis, the allele for black fur <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is dominant to the allele for gray fur <math alttext="lowercase b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. In a particular population of gray squirrels, 64% have black fur and 36% have gray fur. A researcher calculated the allelic frequencies to be <math alttext="uppercase B equals 0.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lowercase b equals 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Five years later, the researcher returned to the location and determined the allelic frequencies within the squirrel population to be <math alttext="uppercase B equals 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lowercase b equals 0.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following could best explain the increase in the frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele in the population after five years?

choices.label: The frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele increased because it is the dominant allele.

The frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele increased because squirrels with gray fur exhibited greater fitness.
The frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele increased due to the selective pressures of the environment.

The frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele increased because black squirrels randomly mate with other eastern gray squirrels.

content.answer: The frequency of the <math alttext="uppercase B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele increased due to the selective pressures of the environment.
